## Usage in README

Add to the top of your README.md:

```markdown
<div align="center">

# üöÄ Aurora Module Generator

[![npm version](https://img.shields.io/npm/v/@aurora/generators.svg)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@aurora/generators)
[![npm downloads](https://img.shields.io/npm/dm/@aurora/generators.svg)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@aurora/generators)
[![License: MIT](https://img.shields.io/badge/License-MIT-yellow.svg)](https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT)
[![Node Version](https://img.shields.io/node/v/@aurora/generators.svg)](https://nodejs.org)
[![CI/CD](https://github.com/florianogomez/aurora-module-generator/workflows/CI%2FCD/badge.svg)](https://github.com/florianogomez/aurora-module-generator/actions)
[![PRs Welcome](https://img.shields.io/badge/PRs-welcome-brightgreen.svg)](CONTRIBUTING.md)

**Production-ready code generator for modern CRUD applications**

</div>
```

---

## Note

Replace:
- `YOUR_TOKEN` with actual tokens from services
- `your_handle` with your actual Twitter handle
- `yourname` with your actual username on support platforms

Update URLs after publishing to npm and setting up CI/CD.
